$comment: Billing rate sets. Referenced by invoice.json and opportunity.json via rateset_id. Never hardcode rates in procedure files or invoice records — always look them up here. One rateset_id per billing configuration. A business may maintain multiple rate sets (e.g. standard, government, preferred client).

ratesets.$rateset_id_note: ID referenced in invoice records and opportunity estimates. Format: [year]-[label].
ratesets.label: Standard Billing Rates
ratesets.$expires_note: Leave blank if no expiration. Rate set remains active until superseded.
ratesets.$structure_note: role_based = different rates per discipline. blended = one rate for all labor.
ratesets.$blended_note: Used when structure = blended. Set to 0 if structure = role_based.

roles.label: Project Manager
roles.$rate_note: Hourly billing rate for this role. Set to 0 if role is not billed separately (e.g. PM included in blended rate).

roles.label: Administrative
roles.$admin_note: Include if admin time is billable on any project type.

ratesets.$odc_note: Markup applied to other direct costs (materials, travel, subcontractors) if any. 0 = no markup. Example: 10 = cost + 10%.

ratesets.$comment: Example of a second rate set — government/prime subcontract rates. Copy and configure as needed.
ratesets.label: Government Contract Rates
ratesets.notes: Government and prime subcontract work. Verify applicable FAR/DFARS billing requirements before use.
